Shiplap on the walls, vintage kitchen sink, and fireplace (non-working of course) added to the historical decor. For history buffs, it was a nice surprise to be across the street from Sam Houston's grave, located in a very old cemetery, which has interesting historical markers throughout. Although parking is on the street, and being an older home, there are two steps from the street and two more steps to the front porch. The bathroom has had a nice renovation, although the shower is on the small side. Towels were of a lovely quality. We would stay here again, and can definitely recommend to others.

review_text: This is the most unusual Air BnB we have had the pleasure of staying at. It was beautiful, the accomodations were lovely (our cabin was very well-appointed), and the amenities were awesome! The winery was a wonderful place to relax and sample some fine Texas wines (we were also able to tour the winery production room - a neat experience!) Diego answered all of our wine questions and provided interesting information about the wines and the process for making them. We sampled white and red wines made from grapes grown on the property while watching the wildlife residing on the ranch. The wildlife includes donkeys, a zebra, 2 offspring called "zebronkeys", Great Pyrenees dogs who guard the livestock (and like to play with them), Black angus cattle, and more. The dogs are super-friendly and hung out with us at our cabin a couple of times. Our cabin's back porch looked out over some vineyards, pastures and a lake with a gazebo. It was so pretty. There are also fire pits available at the cabins and at the winery sampling building, where you can sit and relax on the patio. Overall, it is a really well-done Air BnB place to relax for a few days. Side note: there was also a camel in-residence, but it passed away suddenly over the summer. The plan is to bring in a mama and baby camel sometime in 2020. We would love to return and meet them!

Overall, the house is pleasing in pictures but not practical in person.

review_text:
I stayed at matthews for a little more than a month on and off while I was working in Huntsville. Idk what the last person was talking about in her review. Yes the parking lot is across the street from his house but 90% of the time it is empty besides Matthew's truck and his roommates car. Also the street you have to cross is a small 2 lane back street with very little almost non existant traffic so walking across it is not even a second thought. The house is older but is in fact clean. It just has the usual signs of an older house which is no problem. The room is very big, like stated in the description it is a living room converted to a bedroom for guests. Its has a couch a large 50+ inch TV with an Amazon fire stick so if you have a Netflix or hulu or Amazon prime account you can use it and it is very nice. The only things you should be aware of that are not necessarily cons, at least not to me are that the bed is a twin bed so couples would have a hard time sleeping together but he does have a cot that can be arranged next to the bed. And the second things is that there are not actual doors but 2 sliding track curtains on either side of the room. There not really curtains but I cant thing of another way to describe them. They offer 100% privacy but they are not lockable, it shouldn't be a concern, it wasnt for me, because Matthew seems like a very honest and trustworthy host as does his room mate but something that I figured I should mention.
I give this place 5 stars for being an awesome budget place to stay, with an amazing host, all the basics and some nice extras. If you want the 5 star hotel experience then this isnt the place but you cant expect that for the price. But it does offer a whole lot more than what you pay and easily beats out any motel 6 or super 8 and even some nicer hotels youd pay twice the cost.

The good about Matthew's Place:
First of all, this young man is very nice. Since the parking is off-site, he was king to offer to help us carry all our luggage in. He is personable, will talk to you, seems genuinely friendly & kind.
And everything else about Matthew's Place:
I read reviews. I rent out rooms in my own home, and I've done this for nearly 19 years. I kind of know what is to be expected with common spaces & renting rooms. I was appalled to say the least, and I'm wondering where on earth all these "sparkling clean" reviews came from -- this place was NOT clean at all. I will not go into all the detail here, because it's been shared with Matthew; however just be aware what the profile says. There are two young male college students living here (no mom, as described in one photo), just two guys & a dog. Please be prepared the standards might not be what you would expect from all other airbnb'ers.
In addition, just so you know because this is not in the description of the house, the parking is off-site. It's a small "parking lot" that is adjacent from the house; however you are crossing over (I think) 3 lanes of traffic. There is no crosswalk & the cars do not have a stop sign or a light. This is not easy with anyone elderly or when carrying lots of baggage.
